column1: Here he was! And nervously he tied a bow in front of the mirror
column2: jammed his hair down with both hands
column3: pulled out the flaps of his jacket pockets. Making between £500 and £600 a year on a fruit farm in —of all places— Rhodesia. No capital. Not a penny coming to him. No chance of his income increasing for at least four years. As for looks and all that sort of thing
column4: he was completely out of the running. He couldn't even boast of top-hole health
column5: for the East Africa business had knocked him out so thoroughly that he'd had to take six months' leave. He was still fearfully pale—worse even than usual this afternoon
column7: bending forward and peering into the mirror. Good heavens! What had happened? His hair looked almost bright green. Dash it all
column8: he hadn't green hair at all events. That was a bit too steep. And then the green light trembled in the glass; it was the shadow from the tree outside.
